name: 1.1 - Check that current revision drawings are being used
Acceptance Criteria: Issued For Construction (IFC) and latest available revision used
Reference Documents: IFC Project Drawings/ Drawing Register
Record of conformity: Latest revision IFC drawings
1.2 - Confirm understanding of current EMP related to the work area and that all prescribed environmental controls are in place
Acceptance Criteria: All environmental measures to be implemented as per current EMP and local authorities. Sediment control measures to be installed and protected vegetation to be clearly identified
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
Inspection / Test Method: Document review & Site inspection
Record of conformity: Approved TMP & MOA

Acceptance Criteria: Survey activities undertaken to ensure and validate that all works meet level and location requirements. The establishment and integrity of the survey network shall be verified before commencing any survey and set out activity. IFC and latest available revision used.
Record of conformity: Survey records & marks on the ground. This ITP Signed off.

Acceptance Criteria: Where material is scheduled for measurement by loose volume in delivery vehicles or by mass, a delivery docket for each load shall be issued to the Superintendent at the point of delivery.
Inspection / Test Method: Visual and Measure
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Crushed rock to be a single layer 150mm thick  constructed within the tolerances specified in Clause 306.03.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria: The moisture content of the material at the time of spreading and compaction, expressed as a percentage by mass, shall be within plus 2% and minus 2% from the Modified optimum moisture content.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Except for the purpose of curing, no water shall be added to the cementitious treated material.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria: Pavement subbase shall be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and shall, after compaction, conform within the following limits to the levels, lines, grades, thicknesses and cross sections as specified or shown on the drawings.
○ The width of pavement measured on each side of the centreline or design line shall not deviate by more than 50 mm from the designed offset when measured at a right angle.
○ Minimum Number of measuremnts per lot: 40
Reference Documents: VicRoads Sec. 306.03 Table 306.031, Table 306.032
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: The layout of joints shall conform to the following requirements unless otherwise approved by the Superintendent:
(a) material shall be spread in such a manner as to minimise the number of joints;
(b) in any layer, transverse joints in adjoining paver runs shall be offset by not less than 2 m;
(c) transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 2 m;
(d) longitudinal joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 150 mm;
(e) longitudinal joints shall be located within 300 mm of the planned position of traffic lane lines or within 300 mm of the centre of a traffic lane.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Compacted to at least 95% modified dry density ratio with a mean value of at least 96% modified dry density ratio.

○ The cementitious treated subbase material shall be placed, trimmed to level and fully compacted within the maximum allowable working time specified in Table 306.091 depending on the binder type and the time of year the subbase is being placed. (Table Attached Below)
Reference Documents: EW-CE-DRW-406-001 (Rev D) VicRoads Sec. 306.09
2.8 - Curing and Protection of Compacted Layers
Acceptance Criteria: For Minimum Youngs Modulus of 500MPa,
○ The surface of each compacted layer shall be kept moist for a period of seven days unless covered at an earlier stage with the succeeding layer or with an approved curing membrane.
○ Construction or other traffic shall not use a compacted layer within 24 hours of placement without the approval of the Superintendent.
○ The subbase shall be kept in good order and condition and free from contamination.
Reference Documents: EW-CE-DRW-406-001 (Rev D) VicRoads Sec. 306.11 (a)

Acceptance Criteria: Test rolling may be carried out in accordance with the requirements of Section 173 (Specifically Section 173.03) on the cementitious treated pavement subbase layer within the maximum allowable working time for the relevant binder and time of year as specified in Table 306.091.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
3.2 - Testing and Acceptance of Compaction (Scale B)
Acceptance Criteria: The work represented by the lot will be accepted as far as compaction is concerned if the mean density ratio for the lot is not less than 96.0%
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Mean values of all level readings taken in the lot: +6mm to -12mm, Maximum Standard Deviation of 13mm
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: No point on the prepared surface of the subgrade shall lie more than 12 mm below a 3 metre straight edge placed on the pavement in any direction.
No point on the surface of the cementitious treated subbase layer shall vary by more than 8 mm from a 3 metre straight edge, or 10 mm from a 6 metre straight edge, placed in any direction.
○ Water shall not pond on the surface of the cementitious treated subbase.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
